result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Edward W. Smith

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Atty fees added to 14CF269 to cover this case.  Payments to be made in 14CF269.
NOTICE OF RIGHT TO SEEK POSTCONVICTION RELIEF
DEF PRESENT W/ATTY QUACKENBUSH - CASE DISMISSED & READ IN
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 28, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Edward W. Smith
Current: 1200 Sugarberry Blvd. Lot 2, Sparta, WI 54656 United States  (Effective: 04-29-2015)
Prior: 10669 Impala Avenue, Sparta, WI 54656
to Modify Bond

No consumption or possession of alcohol.  No entering taverns, bars or liquor stores for any purpose.
May not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription in own name and take as prescribed by a licensed provider.
DEFENDANT MUST COMPLY WITH THE BOND MONITORING PROGRAM.  UPON SIGNING OF THE BOND, DEFENDANT MUST APPEAR AT THE JUSTICE PROGRAM OFFICE TO SIGN UP DURING THE HOURS OF 8:00 A.M. - 4:30 P.M.  THE JUSTICE PROGRAM OFFICE IS LOCATED AT 919 HOESCHLER DRIVE, SUITE 100, SPARTA, WI.
Curfew 7pm-7am.
Extension to curfew:  Defendant's curfew is extended to 8pm on April 30, 2015, in order for him to attend his child's school concert.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Def paid $100 on 15CF17 and $100 on 14CF269.  Separate payment plans on 15CF17 and 14CF269.  He is paid up to March 15, 2015 on both cases.  Court approves an extension on April 15, 2015's payments to the end of the day on May 4, 2015 on both cases.
Defendant appears in person with Attorney Quackenbush.  Court takes off calendar.
Plea/Schedule on April 20, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant appears in person with Attorney Quackenbush.  Defendant waives reading.  Court advises of charges and penalties and enters Not Guilty plea.
Plea/Schedule- April 20, 2015 @ 9:00 a.m.

Defendant appears in person with Attorney Quackenbush.  Court gives the right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the right to a preliminary hearing.  Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.  Information filed.
Letter received from Attorney Quackenbush to Judge Rice dated March 9, 2015.
Plea/Schedule on March 16, 2015 at 09:00 am.
No status letter received from Atty Quackenbush.
Atty fee pmt due for 2-15-15 - no payment/arrangements made - gave file to Judge Goodman to address atty fee pmt with other case 14CF269
for Pretrial Conference and Status (Felony--Time Limits Waived)

Defendant appears in person with Attorney Quackenbush.  Defendant waives reading.  Court gives the right to a Preliminary Hearing within 20 days.  Defendant waives time limits to Preliminary Hearing.
Pretrial Conference- February 16, 2015 @ 1:30 p.m.
Status Conference- March 2, 2015 @ 3:00 p.m.
Adjourned initial appearance on February 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Granted.  Attorney Quackenbush @ $50/mth. beginning February 15, 2015
